questions.question: How does the arrival rate impact the performance of the M/M/C/N queuing model?

answers.a: Increasing the arrival rate will increase the mean waiting time in the queue
answers.b: Increasing the arrival rate will decrease the utilization factor
answers.c: Increasing the arrival rate will decrease the mean number of customers in the system
answers.d: Increasing the arrival rate will increase the mean service time

explanations.a: Increasing the arrival rate will decrease the mean number of customers in the system. As the arrival rate increases, customers arrive faster and the queue starts to fill up. This reduces the average number of customers in the system
explanations.b: Increasing the arrival rate will decrease the mean number of customers in the system. As the arrival rate increases, customers arrive faster and the queue starts to fill up. This reduces the average number of customers in the system
explanations.c: Increasing the arrival rate will decrease the mean number of customers in the system. As the arrival rate increases, customers arrive faster and the queue starts to fill up. This reduces the average number of customers in the system
explanations.d: Increasing the arrival rate will decrease the mean number of customers in the system. As the arrival rate increases, customers arrive faster and the queue starts to fill up. This reduces the average number of customers in the system

questions.question: When is the M/M/C/N queuing model appropriate to use?

answers.a: When the system has a finite number of customers
answers.b: When the arrival rate is always equal to the service rate
answers.c: When the service time is deterministic and constant
answers.d: When the number of servers is fixed and known

explanations.a: When the number of servers is fixed and known. The M/M/C/N queuing model is appropriate to use when the number of servers is fixed and known, and customers arrive randomly and are served in a first-come, first-served manner
explanations.b: When the number of servers is fixed and known. The M/M/C/N queuing model is appropriate to use when the number of servers is fixed and known, and customers arrive randomly and are served in a first-come, first-served manner

questions.question: What is the utilization factor of a system in the M/M/C/N queuing model?

answers.a: The ratio of the mean number of customers in the system to the mean waiting time in the queue
answers.b: The ratio of the mean waiting time in the queue to the mean service time
answers.c: The ratio of the mean service time to the mean waiting time in the queue
answers.d: The ratio of the mean number of customers in the system to the number of servers

explanations.a: The ratio of the mean number of customers in the system to the number of servers. It represents the percentage of time that the servers are busy serving customers
explanations.b: The ratio of the mean number of customers in the system to the number of servers. It represents the percentage of time that the servers are busy serving customers
explanations.c: The ratio of the mean number of customers in the system to the number of servers. It represents the percentage of time that the servers are busy serving customers
explanations.d: The ratio of the mean number of customers in the system to the number of servers.It represents the percentage of time that the servers are busy serving customers

questions.question: In the M/M/C/N queuing model, what is the meaning of the utilization factor?

answers.a: The fraction of time that a server is idle
answers.b: The fraction of time that a server is busy
answers.c: The fraction of customers that are served immediately upon arrival
answers.d: The fraction of customers that leave the system without being served

explanations.a: The utilization factor is the fraction of time that a server is busy. It represents how much of the server's capacity is being utilized to serve customers
explanations.b: The utilization factor is the fraction of time that a server is busy. It represents how much of the server's capacity is being utilized to serve customers
